functional.notes: tracks.jsonl validation is streaming and reports line numbers on failures.
evidence: pipeline/src/fusbal_pipeline/cli.py add_contract_error() maps '<path>: line N: ...' into structured errors.
findings: Errors include the failing line number and file path.

correctness_safety.notes: Line numbers are deterministic (1-based) and tied to input order.
findings: JSON parse errors are captured and attributed to the correct line.

performance.notes: Streaming keeps memory usage bounded and scales to large JSONL inputs.
findings: Per-line work is bounded; no accumulating large intermediate structures.

security.notes: Pure file parsing; no external execution.
findings: Uses json.loads with explicit exception handling.
Streaming logic is easy to reason about and test.

summary.notes: Meets goal; consider adding a dedicated test for malformed JSON line mapping.
